title.rendered: Hill Harper to Hold First Events in Campaign for U.S. Senate

content.rendered:
DETROIT – After launching his campaign in a video message posted Monday morning, community leader, small business owner and actor Hill Harper will on Tuesday hold the first events of his campaign for U.S. Senate in Detroit, Pontiac and Grand Rapids. The first events are aimed at rallying public support and bringing attention to the critical issues facing Michiganders.

TUESDAY, JULY 11

Noon Believe in Better Rally with Hill Harper, 662 Woodward Avenue, Detroit.

Washtenaw County Sheriff Jerry Clayton, Northville Mayor Brian Turnbull, American Postal Workers Union Detroit President Keith Combs, and Fems For Dems Founder Lori Goldman are scheduled to attend.

2:30 p.m. Believe in Better Rally with Hill Harper, 1 S. Saginaw St, Pontiac.

6:30 p.m. Believe in Better Rally with Hill Harper, 865 28th St. SE, Grand Rapids.

Journalists interested in attending these events are requested to RSVP to press@hillharper.com.

###
